sen.j: 小荷駄（こにだ）とは、中世から近世にかけての日本において、戦争のために必要な兵糧や弾薬、陣地設営道具などを運ぶための駄賃馬稼（もしくはウシ）・車輌、及びそれを率いる部隊「小荷駄隊（こにだたい）」のこと。
sen.e: Konida refers to dachin umakasegi (a job of carrying by daba, packhorse or cow) or vehicles that carry army provisions, ammunition, set-up tools for encampment and so on needed for wars from the medieval period to modern times in Japan, or a troop that directed the above things, also referred to as konidatai.

sen.j: 現代の輜重隊に相当する。
sen.e: It corresponds to military goods to transport in modern age.
It corresponds to a troop that transports military goods in modern age.
sen.cmt: 「輜重」ではなく、「輜重隊」なので、訳を訂正しました。

sen.j: 主として兵粮奉行（兵粮奉行）率いる、およそ50名から100名の足軽等に護衛された人夫（陣夫）が駄馬や車輌を用いて運搬した。
sen.e: Principally, laborers (servicemen) guarded by fifty to a hundred ashigaru (common foot soldiers) directed by hyoro bugyo (food supply administrator) carried on packhorses or vehicles.
sen.cmt: ひょうりょう奉行は、「兵糧」あるいは「兵粮」と漢字をあてる場合がネット上でも混在しています。
sen.e: Principally, laborers (servicemen) guarded by fifty to a hundred ashigaru (common foot soldiers) who are all directed by hyoro bugyo (food supply administrator) carried goods on packhorses or vehicles.
sen.cmt: 文法的にわかりにくかったため、"who are all" を入れました。carried → carried goods に変更しました。

sen.j: 小荷駄は進撃時には軍勢の後方、後退時には軍勢の先方に配置された。
sen.e: Konida was positioned in the back of the troop during advance and in the front during retreat.

sen.j: 中世においては、兵粮などは兵士達の自己携帯が原則であったが、実戦においては期間が不明でかつ長期分の携帯は軍事行動の妨げになるだけであったため、数日分だけを携帯させてそれ以上の分は小荷駄に輸送させた。
sen.e: In the medieval period, soldiers were basically supposed to carry hyoro by themselves, but at the front, they took along only a few days worth of it and got konida to carry the rest, because the term was unpredictable and the heavy stuff could prevent their military action.

sen.j: 原則として守護は小荷駄に用いる駄馬と陣夫の徴発を行う権利を有しており、戦国大名も同様の実権を保有していたが、実際には小荷駄奉行の裁量に任されていた。
sen.e: In principle, shugo (provincial constable) had a right to press packhorses and servicemen used for konida, and so did warring lords, but actually it was konidabugyo (the commissioner of rear-echelon support troops) who was decision maker.

sen.j: 近世においては小荷駄の徴発に応じる事は領民の義務として位置づけられ、個々の村々に対して石高に応じて徴発された。
sen.e: In modern times, accepting konida's impressment was considered the obligation of the people of the domain, and impressment was conducted according to kokudaka (yield) in each village.

sen.e: Because of this, soldiers were released from the obligation of taking along hyoro.
